title: Irregular & Modal Verbs
reading_greek:
TO BE (Eimai)
- Είμαι, Είσαι, Είναι (I am, You are, He is)
- Είμαστε, Είστε, Είναι (We are, You are, They are)

TO HAVE (Exo)
- Έχω, Έχεις, Έχει (I have, You have, He has)
- Έχουμε, Έχετε, Έχουν (We have, You have, They have)

TO BE ABLE (Boro)
- Μπορώ, Μπορείς, Μπορεί (I can, You can, He can)
- Μπορούμε, Μπορείτε, Μπορούν (We can, You can, They can)

MODAL VERBS (Can / Want)
- Μπορώ (I can - Group B2)
- Θέλω (I want - Group A)

SYNTAX
- Θέλω να φύγω. (I want TO leave).
- Μπορώ να κάνω... (I can DO...).
reading_english:
GRAMMAR: ESSENTIAL VERBS [(See Page 113)](/assets/grammar.pdf#page=113)

1. EIMAI (To Be): Completely irregular. Memorize it.

2. BORO (I Can): It's a B2 Group verb (Ending in -o, not -ao, but stressed!).
   - Boro, Boreis, Borei.
   - Boroume, Boreite, Boroun.

3. THELO (I Want): Standard Group A.
   - Thelo, Theleis, Thelei.
audio_script:
The Power Trio.

1. Eimai (I am). You know this. 
2. Exo (I have). You know this. 

3. Boro (I can). 
Note the stress: Bo-RO. 
It conjugates like this: Boreis, Borei, Boroume.

4. Thelo (I want).
KA-no style: Thelo, Theleis, Thelei.

We combine these with 'NA' (to). 
'Thelo na pao' (I want to go). 
'Boro na pao' (I can go).

quiz_questions.question: Translate 'I want to sleep'.
options: Θέλω να κοιμηθώ / Θέλω να κοιμάμαι.

quiz_questions.question: Conjugate 'Thelo' (You want).
options: Θέλω να κοιμηθώ / Θέλω να κοιμάμαι.

quiz_questions.question: Translate 'We have'.
options: Θέλω να κοιμηθώ / Θέλω να κοιμάμαι.
